intro: Hesperis graeca, commonly known as the Greek hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in early summer, typically arranged in a single, upright stem. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a rough texture and a distinctive, slightly hairy appearance. Hesperis graeca is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
